name: god in the crowd
description:
On this Cap Ji Gwee night, Chinese people hold a tradition at their respective temples. The tradition is to take the god Zhiao Jun or Cio Kun or the god of the kitchen to the sky. 

The god of the kitchen went to heaven to report the behavior of the householder to the creator according to Chinese beliefs. After accompanying the departure of the kitchen god, the caretaker of the temple or monastery then cleans the place of worship to change the robes of the gods and goddesses to clean the ashes.

 "Because after the god went to the sky the statue seemed uninhabited, so we cleaned it along with the temple and knick-knacks," 

This photo is when the statue of the god is being paraded around the temple grounds before being cleaned.
